title: EthernetNetworkInterface.0.91.0
description: This schema defines a simple ethernet NIC resource.
specification: This resource shall be used to represent NIC resources as part of the Redfish specification.

UEFIDevicePath.description: This is the UEFI device path for this NIC.
UEFIDevicePath.specification: The value of this property shall be the UEFI device path of this interface.

FactoryMacAddress.description: This is the MAC address assigned to this NIC at the factory.
FactoryMacAddress.specification: The value of this property shall be the Permanent MAC Address of this interface.

MacAddress.description: This is the currently assigned MAC address for this NIC.
MacAddress.specification: The value of this property shall be the effective current MAC Address of this interface.  If an assignable MAC address is not supported, this is a read only alias of the FactoryMacAddress.

LinkTechnology.description: This is link technology, such as Ethernet, for this NIC.
LinkTechnology.specification: The value of this property shall be the technology of the interface.

SpeedMbps.description: This is the current speed in MBps of this NIC.
SpeedMbps.specification: The value of this property shall be the link speed of the interface in Mbps.

Autosense.description: This indicates if the speed and duplex is automatically configured by the NIC.
Autosense.specification: The value of this property shall be true of autosense of speed and duplex is enabled and false if it is disabled.

FullDuplex.description: This indicates if the NIC is in Full Duplex mode or not.
FullDuplex.specification: The value of this property shall be the connection duplex status.

FrameSize.description: This is the MAC Frame size in bytes.
FrameSize.specification: The value of this property shall be the Ethernet (MAC) frame size in bytes.

VLANEnable.description: This indicates if VLANs are enabled.  If this NIC supports more than one VLAN, this property will not be present and the client should look for VLANs collection in the link section of this resource.
VLANEnable.specification: The value of this property shall be used to indicate if the VLAN is enabled for this interface.  If this interface supports more than one VLAN, the VLANEnable property shall not be present and the VLANS collection link shall be present instead.

VLANId.description: This indicates the VLAN identifier for this NIC.  This property is only present if VLANEnable is used and the NIC only supports a single VLAN.
VLANId.specification: The value of this property shall be used to indicate the VLAN identifier for this interface.  If this interface supports more than one VLAN, the VLANId property shall not be present and the VLANS collection link shall be present instead.

Prefix.description: IPv6 Address Prefix for this table entry as defined in RFC 3484 section 2.1.

Precedence.description: Precedence value for this table entry as defined in RFC 3484 section 2.1.

Label.description: Label value for this table entry, as defined in RFC 3484 section 2.1.

IPv6AddressPolicyTable.description: This array of objects represents the RFC3484 Address Selection Policy Table.
IPv6AddressPolicyTable.specification: This array represents the Address Selection Policy Table as defined in RFC3484.

Address.specification: The value of this property shall be an IPv4 address assigned to this interface.  If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface, this property becomes read-only.

SubnetMask.description: This is the IPv4 Subnet mask.
SubnetMask.specification: The value of this property shall be the IPv4 subnet mask for this address.  If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface, this property becomes read-only.

AddressOrigin.description: This indicates how the address was determined.

enumDescriptions.DHCP: Address is provided by a DHCP service
enumDescriptions.Static: A static address as configured by the user

AddressOrigin.specification: The value of this property shall be the enumeration value from where was this IP obtained.

Gateway.description: This is the IPv4 gateway for this address.
Gateway.specification: The value of this property shall be the IPv4 default gateway address for this interface. If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface and is configured to set the IPv4 default gateway address, this property becomes read-only.

items.description: This object describes the IPv4 portions for this NIC.

IPv4Addresses.description: This array of objects is used to represent the IPv4 connection characteristics for this interface.

Address.specification: This property lists an IPv6 address that is currently assigned on this interface.

PrefixLength.description: This is the IPv6 Address Prefix Length.
PrefixLength.specification: The value of this property shall be the IPv6 address prefix length for this interface.

AddressOrigin.description: This indicates how the address was determined.

enumDescriptions.DHCP: Address is provided by a DHCP service
enumDescriptions.Static: A static address as configured by the user
enumDescriptions.SLAAC: Address is provided by a Stateless Address AutoConfiguration (SLAAC) service

AddressOrigin.specification: The value of this property shall be the IPv6 address origin for this interface.

enumDescriptions.Preferred: This address is currently within both it's valid and preferred lifetimes as defined in RFC 4862.
enumDescriptions.Deprecated: This address is currently within it's valid lifetime, but is now outside of it's preferred lifetime as defined in RFC 4862.
enumDescriptions.Tentative: This address is currently undergoing Duplicate Address Detection testing as defined in RFC 4862 section 5.4.
enumDescriptions.Failed: This address has failed Duplicate Address Detection testing as defined in RFC 4862 section 5.4 and is not currently in use.

AddressState.description: The current state of this address as defined in RFC 4862.
AddressState.specification: Preferred and Deprecated states follow the definitions given RFC4862 Section 5.5.4. An address is in the Tentative state while undergoing Duplicate Address Detection (DAD) per RFC4862 Section 5.4.  The Failed state indicates a Static addresses which did not pass DAD.  A Static address in the Failed state is not in use on the network stack, and corrective action will be needed to remedy this condition.

items.description: This object describes a single IPv6 address currently assigned on this interface.

IPv6Addresses.description: This array of objects enumerates all of the currently assigned IPv6 addresses on this interface.

MaxIPv6StaticAddresses.description: This indicates the maximum number of Static IPv6 addresses that can be configured on this interface.
MaxIPv6StaticAddresses.specification: The value of this property shall indicate the number of array items supported by IPv6StaticAddresses.

Address.specification: This property provides access to a static IPv6 address that is currently assigned on this interface.

PrefixLength.description: The Prefix Length of this IPv6 address.
PrefixLength.specification: Provides the IPv6 network prefix length in bits for this address.

items.description: This object represents a single IPv6 static address to be assigned on this interface.

IPv6StaticAddresses.description: This array of objects represents all of the IPv6 static addresses to be assigned on this interface.

IPv6DefaultGateway.description: This is the IPv6 default gateway address that is currently in use on this interface.
IPv6DefaultGateway.specification: The value of this property shall be the current IPv6 default gateway address that is in use on this interface.

NameServers.specification: The value of this property shall be the DNS name servers for this interface.

HostName.description: This is the DNS Host Name, without any domain information.
HostName.specification: The value of this property shall be host name for this interface.

FQDN.description: This is the complete, fully qualified domain name obtained by DNS for this interface.
FQDN.specification: The value of this property shall be the fully qualified domain name for this interface.

Settings.description: If this resource is supports changing properties by modifying a separate (settings) resource, this is the reference to that resource.
Settings.specification: If network settings are not dynamically settable (e.g. a reset required that doesn't happen automatically), this value shall be used to reference a separately PATCHable representation of this data to be used for configuration purposes.

NetworkServices.description: Since there are settings that apply to more than one NIC, those are contained in the Network Services resource.  This is the reference to that resource.
NetworkServices.specification: The value of this property shall reference a link to the Network Services resource.

VLANs.description: This is a reference to a collection of VLANs and is only used if the NIC supports more than one resource.
VLANs.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Collection with a MemberType of VLAN.  If this property is used, the VLANEnabled and VLANId property shall not be used.

self.description: This is the URI of this resource.
self.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type EthernetNetworkInterface and shall point to this same resource.

links.description: This object represents the references from this resource.

SettingsResult.description: If there is a link to Settings, this property has the results of the last application of those settings to this NIC.
SettingsResult.specification: If using separate Settings, these properties shall report the result of applying settings.
